answers.answer: OMG.  I' m so sorry to hear what has happened to your mother.  It can't just be coincidental that she is having all this trouble right after thyroid surgery.  What med was  she given and what was the starting dose?  Also, if there were thyroid tests done after surgery, could you please post the actual numbers and reference ranges?  This will enable Forum members to give you the best response.   If you don't have the info, the doctor is required to provide you with a copy upon request.  And if you contact the doctor's office, I would ask that they please call the Thyroid Specialist again and express just how serious the situation is and ask for the earliest possible appt., that you can't wait until July 30.I feel that I should also ask, just how sure you are that the "Thyroid Specialist" really  knows about thyroid problems?  Our experience here is that  finding a good thyroid doctor is very difficult and a good one is worth his weight in gold.If you will answer these questions, maybe we can provide some useful responses.

this is what i have accumulated so far:surgery was aug. 08...started on: levathyroxin .75 for 9mo'sthen on: levathyroxin 1.25 for 2wks (this is when symptoms started)then on: sythroid 100 for 2 daysthen on: levathyroxin .75 for 1wkthen on: nothing for 3 daystoday started on: synthroid .88im working on getting the post surgery test results!!!

doctor were working on getting in to:Dr. Barbara BakerTulsa, OKEndocrinologyDiabetes SpecialistInternal Medicinewe were refered here by multiple people locally... yet, i guess my moms current doctor thinks this isnt necessary!!!

Something that would make me leery would be the fact that she is a diabetes specialist.  Our experience is that Diabetes specialists aren't up to speed on thyroid as well.  Of course there is also the waiting time, not only for now but in the future should you go there.  I am going to PM you with  a Doctor that I found in the top thyroid docs listing.  Might be worthwhile checking out.  Also, I suggest that you post a new message asking if anyone can send you a PM with a good thyroid doctor in your area, with whom  they have good feedback  or personal experience.

question: Im here asking questions because my mom is suddenly not herself!  My mother had her entire thyroid removed about 6mo's ago (approx).  about 3wks ago she started taking her thyroid medicine.  she started out just feeling junky, but slowly progressed to horrible.  she has been feeling like her skin was going to fall off, never sleeps, never eats, cant stand-up or even sit down...  she is MISERABLE!  a woman that just a month ago was extremely caring, loving, extremely kind hearted...etc...  is now someone else...  she wants no-one around, doesnt want to talk to anyone on the phone and just wants to be alone...  she is more depressed than ive ever seen anyone!  she was taken to the emergency room on saturday and nothing was done...  on sunday my father made an emergency call to her doctor and explained to him that something needed to be changed... my mom had talked about not wanting to live anymore and leaving this world...  my family is very well known and respected in our community and church, my mother has more friends than i could ever dream of having, and she has been happy her entire life till now!  her doctor had my mother put in laurette hospital (crazy people place)????  something is wrong with this picture!!!  ive researched and found a local Thyroid Specialist, but there is like a 5mo waiting list...  i called them anyways and let them know the situation, they then said that my mom could be worked in with a call from her doctor letting them know that it is a serious issue!  me and my father both called her doctor to ask for this to be done, but got nothing except for a resenting conversation from him... finally a call from the laurette doctor to my mothers doctor got him to make the phone call, but apparently he didnt express the urgency to the Thyroid doctor....  all we have now is a situation where they can squeez my mom in the 30th of july...  im sorry this is so long!  i just want to get this off my chest and give you all the info im aware of...  is this a normal problem???  is there anything i can do???  all i want is to see my mom happy again....
title: Mom needs help???
